Just Cause of DPRK Supported by Norodom Sihanouk 
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Kingdom of Cambodia with King Sihamoni as its head will always extend positive support to the just cause of the DPRK and the struggle of the Korean people to reunify the country under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il in the future, too. The Great King of Cambodia Norodom Sihanouk said this when receiving Choe Han Chun, DPRK ambassador e. p. to Cambodia together with the king and the great queen on Dec. 9.
 The great king recalled that he was fortunate to establish nearly four decades ago special fraternal relationship with President Kim Il Sung, the outstanding great man, whom the Korean people acclaimed and held in high esteem for the first time in Korea's history spanning thousands of years.    
 He said the Cambodians would always remember the fact that the President gave material and moral support and aid to Cambodia in all fields in the past. He praised Kim Il Sung as the most distinguished great leader among the world leaders and Kim Jong Il as the great leader boundlessly respected and loved by the Korean people.

articles.title: Crackdown on Hanchongryon Flailed in S. Korea
U.S. Dangerous Attempt to Threaten Regional Peace Flailed
articles.content:
Crackdown on Hanchongryon Flailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) reportedly made public a statement on December 9, castigating the public security authorities for arresting its Chairman Paek Jong Ho on the charge of violation of the "National Security Law".
 His arrest vividly reveals the intention of the authorities to stamp out the student movement and not to give up the designation of Hanchongryon as an "enemy-benefiting" organization, said the statement.    
 Branding the public security forces including the prosecution and police as a criminal group blocking advance in the era of independence and reunification and challenging democracy, the statement warned that the public security authorities suppressing patriotic activities for reunification with the "enemy-benefiting" label would face a judgment by history.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Hungarian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Sandor Meszaros, Hungarian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
 On hand were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials of the Hungarian embassy here.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president conversed with the Hungarian ambassador.
